The Arm Commander: API Documentation

arm_commander.commander_moveit module

class arm_commander.commander_moveit.GeneralCommander(moveit_group_name: str, world_link: str | None = None)

Bases: object

GeneralCommander: an interface for robot commander, with this class specifically interfacing to Moveit

abort_move(wait=True)

Abort the current command

Parameters:

wait (bool, optional) – blocks the return of function call until the abort operation has finished, defaults to True

add_box_to_scene(object_name: str, dimensions: list, xyz: list, rpy: list = [0, 0, 0], reference_frame: str | None = None)

Add a box to the scene for collision avoidance in path planning

Parameters:

  • object_name (str) – The name given to the new scene object

  • dimensions – The dimensions of the box as a list of 3 floats

  • xyz (list) – The position of the box in the world/default reference frame

  • rpy (list) – The orientation of the box in the world/default reference frame

  • reference_frame (str, default to WORLD_REFERENCE_LINK) – The frame of reference of the xyz and rpy

add_named_pose(name: str, joint_values: list)

Add a named pose specified in joint positions to the commander

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the pose to be defined

  • joint_values (list) – a list of joint values

add_object_to_scene(object_name: str, model_file: str, object_scale: list, xyz: list, rpy: list, reference_frame: str | None = None)

Add an object (defined with a meshed model, pose, scale) to the scene for collision avoidance in path planning

Parameters:

  • object_name (str) – The name given to the new scene object

  • model_file (str) – The path to the file that defines the mesh of the object

  • object_scale (list) – The list of scale in 3 dimension

  • xyz (list) – The position of the object in the world/default reference frame

  • rpy (list) – The orientation of the object in euler angles in the world/default reference frame

  • reference_frame (str, default to WORLD_REFERENCE_LINK) – The frame of reference of the xyz and rpy

add_path_constraints(constraint)

Add a constraint to the commander. Refer to :module:’arm_commander.moveit_tools’ for functions to conveniently create a constraint object

Parameters:

constraint (OrientationConstraint, JointConstraint or PositionConstraint) – The constraint to be added to the commander

add_sphere_to_scene(object_name: str, radius: float, xyz: list, reference_frame: str | None = None)

Add an object to the scene for collision avoidance in path planning

Parameters:

  • object_name (str) – The name given to the new scene object

  • radius (float) – The radius of the sphere

  • xyz (list) – The position of the sphere in the world/default reference frame

  • reference_frame (str, default to WORLD_REFERENCE_LINK) – The frame of reference of the xyz and rpy

attach_object_to_end_effector(object_name: str) → bool

Attach an object, name defined in the world, to the end effector :param object_name: the name of the object to be attached :type object_name: str :return: True if the attach is successful :rtype: bool

clear_path_constraints()

Clear all the added constraints in the commander

controller_select(controller_type: ControllerState = ControllerState.TRAJECTORY) → bool

Attempts to select a given controller via controller manager

Parameters:

controller_type (ControllerState, optional) – Controller state to set to, defaults to ControllerState.TRAJECTORY (0)

Returns:

Success (True) or Failure (False)

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

Returns:

Pairs of (joint_name, position) in a dictionary

Return type:

dict

Parameters:

print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

detach all attached objects from the end_effector

detach_object_from_end_effector(object_name: str) → None

detach the named object from the robot :param object_name: the name of the object to be detached :type object_name: str

disable_path_constraints()

Disable the added constraints from taking effect in the next commands

enable_path_constraints()

Enable the added constraints

invoke_service(ns: str, cls, **kwargs)

Invokes a service of given namespace (ns) and class (cls) Credit: https://github.com/ros-controls/ros_control/issues/511

Parameters:

  • ns (str) – Namespace of service to invoke

  • cls (Any (depends on invoked class type. Check service in commandline using 'rosservice info ns')) – Class of service object

list_object_names() → list
move_displacement(dx=0.0, dy=0.0, dz=0.0, accept_fraction=0.9999, wait=True) → Pose

Command the robot arm to move the end effector by a displacement (dx, dy, dz) in a cartesian motion manner

Parameters:

  • dx (float, optional) – displacement in x axis, defaults to 0

  • dy (float, optional) – displacement in y axis, defaults to 0

  • dz (float, optional) – displacement in z axis, defaults to 0

  • accept_fraction (float, optional) – the acceptable minimum fraction of the planned path towards the target or abort the command, defaults to 0.9999

  • wait (bool, optional) – The call is blocked until the command has been completed, defaults to True

Returns:

The target pose

Return type:

Pose

move_to_named_pose(named_pose: str, wait=True)

Command the robot arm to move to a named pose (joint-space) as defined in the scene model or the commander through :method: ‘add_named_pose’.

Parameters:

  • named_pose (str) – The name of pre-defined named pose

  • wait (bool, optional) – The call is blocked until the command has been completed, defaults to True

move_to_pose(target_pose, reference_frame: str | None = None, wait=True) → Pose
Command the robot arm to move the end effector to a pose optionally in a particular frame of reference

the target_pose may be a list of 6 numbers (xyz+rpy), 7 numbers (xyz+4q), Pose or PoseStamped

Parameters:

  • target_pose (a list of 6 floats (xyzrpy), 7 floats (xyzq), Pose, or PoseStamped) – The target pose

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – The frame of reference in which positions are specified, defaults to the world/default

  • wait (bool, optional) – The call is blocked until the command has been completed, defaults to True

Returns:

The target pose in the given reference frame

Return type:

Pose

move_to_position(x: float | None = None, y: float | None = None, z: float | None = None, accept_fraction: float = 0.9999, cartesian=False, reference_frame: str | None = None, wait=True) → Pose

Command the robot arm to move the end effector to a position (x, y, z) optionally in a cartesian motion manner and optionally in a specified frame of reference

Parameters:

  • x (float, optional) – the target x position, defaults to the current x position

  • y (float, optional) – the target y position, defaults to the current y position

  • z (float, optional) – the target z position, defaults to the current z position

  • accept_fraction (float, optional) – the acceptable minimum fraction of the planned path towards the target or abort the command, defaults to 0.9999

  • cartesian (bool, optional) – use cartesian motion as the path, defaults to False

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – frame of reference in which positions are specified, defaults to the world/default

  • wait (bool, optional) – the call is blocked until the command has been completed, defaults to True

Returns:

The target pose in the given reference frame

Return type:

Pose

pose_in_frame(link_name: str | None = None, reference_frame: str | None = None, ros_time: Time | None = None) → PoseStamped

Get the pose of a link as a PoseStamped

Parameters:

  • link_name (str, optional) – The name of the link to be queried, defaults to the end-effector

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – The name of the frame of reference, defaults to the world/default

  • ros_time (rospy.Time, optional) – The time when the pose is queried, defaults to current time

Raises:

ValueError – when the names of the link_name or reference_frame is invalid

Returns:

The pose as a PoseStamped

Return type:

PoseStamped

pose_in_frame_as_xyzq(link_name: str | None = None, reference_frame: str | None = None, ros_time: Time | None = None, print=False) → list

Get the pose of a link as a list of 7 floats (xyzq)

Parameters:

  • link_name (str, optional) – The name of the link to be queried, defaults to the end-effector

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – The name of the frame of reference, defaults to the world/default

  • ros_time (rospy.Time, optional) – The time when the pose is queried, defaults to current time

  • print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

Raises:

ValueError – when the names of the link_name or reference_frame is invalid

Returns:

The pose in the format of a list of 7 floats (xyzq)

Return type:

list

pose_in_frame_as_xyzrpy(link_name: str | None = None, reference_frame: str | None = None, ros_time: Time | None = None, print=False) → list

Get the pose of a link as a list of 6 floats (xyzrpy)

Parameters:

  • link_name (str, optional) – The name of the link to be queried, defaults to the end-effector

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – The name of the frame of reference, defaults to the world/default

  • ros_time (rospy.Time, optional) – The time when the pose is queried, defaults to current time

  • print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

Raises:

ValueError – when the names of the link_name or reference_frame is invalid

Returns:

The pose in the format of a list of 6 floats (xyzrpy)

Return type:

list

  • print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

Returns:

Return type:

remove_object(object_name: str) → None

Remove object given the name or all objects in the scene if None

Parameters:

object_name (str) – The name of the object, None for removing all objects

reset_state() → None

Set the state of the commander to READY, remove records of previous commands and ready to accept new comamnds

reset_world()

Remove all scene objects that have been added through the commander

rotate_to_orientation(roll: float | None = None, pitch: float | None = None, yaw: float | None = None, reference_frame: str | None = None, wait=True)

Command the robot arm to rotate the end effector to an orientation (rpy) optionally in a particular frame of reference

Parameters:

  • roll (float, optional) – The target roll orientation, defaults to the current value

  • pitch (float, optional) – The target pitch orientation, defaults to the current value

  • yaw (float, optional) – The target yaw orientation, defaults to the current value

  • reference_frame (str, optional) – The frame of reference in which positions are specified, defaults to the world/default

  • wait (bool, optional) – The call is blocked until the command has been completed, defaults to True

Returns:

The target pose in the given reference frame

Return type:

Pose

rpy_of_robot_link(robot_link_name: str | None = None, print=False) → list

Get the orientation of a link as a list of euler angles (rpy) in the default move_group planning frame

Parameters:

  • robot_link_name (str, optional) – The name of the link to be queried, defaults to the end-effector

  • print (bool, optional) – Sends the information to the output as well, defaults to False

Returns:

The pose of a link as a list of euler angles (rpy)

Return type:

list

servo_robot(twist: Twist, frame: str = '', time: float = 0) → bool

Attempt to servo the robot with provided Twist

Parameters:

  • twist (Twist) – Twist message containing linear and angular velocity components

  • frame (str) – Frame to apply twist to (from robot tree)

  • time (float, optional) – Time in seconds to apply twist, defaults to 0 seconds

Returns:

True on success, else False

Return type:

bool

set_goal_tolerance(tol_list: list)

Set the goal tolerance

Parameters:

tol_list (list) – set the goal tolerance as a list of joint, position and orientation goal tolerances

set_max_cartesian_speed(max_speed: float | None = None)

Set the maximum speed of the end-effector motion

Parameters:

max_speed (float, optional) – The maximum speed in meters per seconds, defaults to the system default speed

set_planning_time(planning_time: int)

Set the maximum planning time

Parameters:

planning_time (int) – The maximum planning time in seconds

set_workspace_walls(min_x: float, min_y: float, min_z: float, max_x: float, max_y: float, max_z: float)

A convenient function for setting up a workspace as a space surrounded by 6 walls

Parameters:

  • min_x (float) – The minimum x of the workspace

  • min_y (float) – The minimum y of the workspace

  • min_z (float) – The minimum z of the workspace

  • max_x (float) – The maximum x of the workspace

  • max_y (float) – The maximum y of the workspace

  • max_z (flost) – The maximum z of the workspace

spin(spin_in_thread: bool = True) → None

Starts the arm commander. If the parameter is True, the arm_commander is running in a new thread, If otherwise, the commander is running in the caller’s thread, blocking the call.

Parameters:

spin_in_thread (bool, optional) – create a new thread for the loop, defaults to True

transform_pose(the_pose: PoseStamped, to_frame: str) → PoseStamped

Transorm a pose from the current frame of reference to another frame of reference

Parameters:

  • the_pose (PoseStamped) – The pose to be transformed

  • to_frame (str) – The target frame of reference

Returns:

The transformed pose

Return type:

PoseStamped

The final state of the commander

GeneralCommanderStates

timeout (float, optional) – _description_, defaults to 10.0

class arm_commander.commander_moveit.GeneralCommanderFactory

Bases: object

The factory object ensures that, in a system involving multiple general commander object, there is at most one object for each manipulator

get_object(world_link: str | None = None) → GeneralCommander

Returns, and if needed, creates an general commander for the given moveit_group_name, a manipulation group defined in the setup assistant (or the custom.env file)

Parameters:

  • moveit_group_name (str) – The name of the manipulation group

  • world_link (str, optional) – the frame of reference for planning, defaults to the world defined in the moveit configuraiton

Returns:

The general commander for the manipulation group

Return type:

GeneralCommander

object_store = {}

arm_commander.moveit_tools module

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_code_to_string_map(the_class, keep_full_uppercase: bool = True, omit_begin_underscore: bool = True) → dict
A utility for converting the uppercase variables of a class into a string map for conversion from variable values to variable names.

It is applied on non-Enum class and provides a similar functionality of printing out the name of an Enum value

Parameters:

  • the_class (A Python class definition) – The class that contains the variables

  • keep_full_uppercase (bool, optional) – Extracts only the variables in full uppercase, defaults to True

  • omit_begin_underscore (bool, optional) – Omits the variables beginning with an underscore, defaults to True

Returns:

the string map (variable value, variable names)

Return type:

dict

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_path_joint_constraint(joint_name: str, min_value: float, max_value: float) → JointConstraint

Return a populated joint constraint

Parameters:

  • joint_name (str) – the name of the joint subject to the constraint

  • min_value (float) – the allowable minimum joint value

  • max_value (float) – the allowable maximum joint value

Returns:

The populated joint constraint

Return type:

JointConstraint

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_path_orientation_constraint(link_name: str, current_pose: PoseStamped, x_axis: float, y_axis: float, z_axis: float) → OrientationConstraint

Return a populated orientation constraint

Parameters:

  • link_name (str) – the name of the robot_link subject to the constraint

  • current_pose (PoseStamped) – The current pose of the link that is used as the reference

  • x_axis (float) – The absolute tolerance in the x axis

  • y_axis (float) – The absolute tolerance in the y axis

  • z_axis (float) – The absolute tolerance in the z axis

Returns:

The populated orientation constraint

Return type:

OrientationConstraint

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_position_constraint(link_name: str, reference_frame: str, xyz: list, dimensions: list) → PositionConstraint

return a populated PositionContraint

Parameters:

  • link_name (str) – the name of the robot_link subject to the constraint

  • reference_frame (str) – the reference frame defining the orientation of the xyz and dimensions

  • xyz (list) – the centroid of the box that defines the position constraint

  • dimensions (list) – the dimension of the box that defines the constraint

Returns:

the populated PositionContraint

Return type:

PositionConstraint

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_position_constraint_from_bbox(link_name: str, reference_frame: str, bbox: list) → PositionConstraint

return a populated PositionContraint

Parameters:

  • link_name (str) – the name of the robot_link subject to the constraint

  • reference_frame (str) – the reference frame defining the orientation of the xyz and dimensions

  • bbox (a list of 6 numbers (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)) – the bounding box that defines the position constraint

Returns:

the populated PositionContraint

Return type:

PositionConstraint

arm_commander.moveit_tools.create_position_constraint_on_link_orientation(link_name: str, current_pose: PoseStamped, dimensions_in_pose_orientation: list) → PositionConstraint

return a populated PositionContraint

Parameters:

  • link_name (str) – the name of the robot_link subject to the constraint

  • current_pose (PoseStamped) – the reference pose based on which the dimension in the position constraint is defined, with the reference pose at the centroid

  • dimensions_in_pose_orientation (list) – the dimension of the box that defines the position constraint

Returns:

the populated PositionContraint

Return type:

PositionConstraint

arm_commander.moveit_tools.in_region(x: float, y: float, bbox_as_list: list) → bool

Test if the point (x, y) is in the bbox

Parameters:

  • x (float) – the x value of the point

  • y (float) – the y value of the point

  • bbox_as_list ((x1, y1, x2, y2)) – the bounding square

Returns:

True if the point (x, y) is within the bbox

Return type:

bool

the_pose (PoseStamped) – The pose

Returns:

The pose in xyzrpy

Return type:

list

arm_commander.moveit_tools.same_joint_values_with_tolerence(joint_values_1: list, joint_values_2: list, tolerance: float) → bool

Test if the two sets of joint values are the same

Parameters:

  • joint_values_1 (list) – the first set of joint_values

  • joint_values_2 (list) – the second set of joint values

  • tolerance (float) – the absolute tolerance for the comparison

Returns:

True if the two sets of joint values are deemed the same

Return type:

bool

arm_commander.moveit_tools.same_pose_with_tolerence(pose_1, pose_2, tolerance: float) → bool
Test if the values in two lists are within a tolerance of each other.

For Pose and PoseStamped inputs, the angle between the two quaternions is compared (the angle between the identical orientations q and -q is calculated correctly). Applicable for joint space.

Parameters:

  • goal (A list of floats, a Pose or a PoseStamped) – A pose

  • actual (A list of floats, a Pose or a PoseStamped) – another pose

  • tolerance (float) – the absolute tolerance for the comparison

Returns:

True if the goal and actual are the same

Return type:

bool

arm_commander.moveit_tools.same_rpy_with_tolerence(rpy_1: list, rpy_2: list, tolerance: float) → bool

Test if two euler’s angles are the same

Parameters:

  • rpy_1 (list) – the first orientation in euler’s angle

  • rpy_2 (list) – the second orientation in euler’s angle

  • tolerance (float) – the absolute tolerance for the comparison

Returns:

True if the two orientations are deemed the same

Return type:

bool

arm_commander.moveit_tools.xyzrpy_to_pose_stamped(xyzrpy: list, reference_frame: str) → PoseStamped

Convert a pose in the form of xyzrpy (list) to a PoseStamped object

Parameters:

  • xyzrpy (list) – a list of 6 numbers

  • reference_frame (str) – the reference frame of this pose

Returns:

the created Pose object according to the parameter

Return type:

Pose
